intro: Boeberastrum anthemidifolium, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Boeberastrum anthemidifolium is often found in disturbed areas and is considered an herbaceous perennial.
